Mike Choe wrote: 
> hi all. 
>=
 how can you define your own testing criteria in JUnit? 
> i think there's =
a way and i thought i read about it somewhere but i'm 
> blanking out. 

It=
 depends what you mean by "testing criteria". 

You can extend the TestCase=
 class to have additional assert methods if
you want to routinely check on =
different things. For example, I've got a
group of class doing a fair bit o=
f work with reflection. I ended up
defining a new test base class, and adde=
d a method like this:

public void assertType(Class expectedType, Object o)=
 { 
  assertNotNull("Can't really check the type of a null object", 0); 
  =
assert("Expected type <" + expectedType.toString() + ">. Actual Type:
<" + =
o.getClass().toString() + ">", 
         o instanceof expectedType); 
} 

I=
s this the sort of thing you mean? 

Robert.

                   and it hol=
